steps.s0003: Mix brown gravy, cream cheese, and mushrooms with hamburger, stirring until cream cheese melts. Add milk, sour cream, and mushroom soup to cooked pasta. Blend hamburger mixture with pasta.

r0231.title: Skillet Pork Chops with Potatoes and Onion

steps.s0001: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Coat the pork chops with flour, and place in the skillet. Brown about 4 minutes on each side.
steps.s0002: In a small bowl, mix the Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle 1/2 the Parmesan cheese mixture over the pork chops. Layer chops with the potatoes. Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese mixture. Top with onion slices.
steps.s0003: In a small bowl, dissolve the beef bouillon cubes in hot water. Stir in the lemon juice. Pour over the layered pork chops.
steps.s0004: Cover skillet, and reduce heat. Simmer 40 minutes, until vegetables are tender and pork chops have reached an internal temperature of 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

steps.s0001: In a medium skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef, onion, and green pepper; drain off liquids.
steps.s0002: Stir in the garlic powder, mustard, ketchup, and brown sugar; mix thoroughly. Reduce heat, and simmer for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

steps.s0001: Spread about 1 1/2 cups of brown sugar on the bottom of the slow cooker crock. Place the ham flat side down into the slow cooker - you might have to trim it a little to make it fit. Use your hands to rub the remaining brown sugar onto the ham. Cover, and cook on Low for 8 hours.

ingredients.i0002: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle root beer
ingredients.i0003: 1 (18 ounce) bottle your favorite barbecue sauce
ingredients.i0004: 8 hamburger buns, split and lightly toasted

steps.s0001: Place the pork tenderloin in a slow cooker; pour the root beer over the meat. Cover and cook on low until well cooked and the pork shreds easily, 6 to 7 hours. Note: the actual length of time may vary according to individual slow cooker. Drain well. Stir in barbecue sauce. Serve over hamburger buns.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Season ribs with salt and pepper. Place in a shallow baking pan. Brown in oven 15 minutes. Turn over, and brown another 15 minutes; drain fat.
steps.s0003: In a medium bowl, mix together the ketchup, chili sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, oregano, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and salt and pepper. Place ribs in slow cooker. Pour sauce over ribs, and turn to coat.
steps.s0004: Cover, and cook on Low 6 to 8 hours, or until ribs are tender.

ingredients.i0008: 4 bone-in pork chops (1/2 to 3/4 inch thick)

steps.s0001: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil the grate.
steps.s0002: In a bowl, mix together the seasoned salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, Worcestershire sauce, and smoke flavoring until thoroughly combined. Rinse pork chops, and sprinkle the wet chops on both sides with the spice mixture. With your hands, massage the spice rub into the meat; allow to stand for 10 minutes.
steps.s0003: Grill the chops over indirect heat until no longer pink inside, about 12 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Allow chops to stand for 10 more minutes before serving.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly oil a 9x9 inch square baking pan.
steps.s0002: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion, green onions and garlic, until soft and lightly browned. Stir in spinach and parsley, and continue to saute until spinach is limp, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
steps.s0003: In a medium bowl, mix together eggs, ricotta, and feta. Stir in spinach mixture. Lay 1 sheet of phyllo dough in prepared baking pan, and brush lightly with olive oil. Lay another sheet of phyllo dough on top, brush with olive oil, and repeat process with two more sheets of phyllo. The sheets will overlap the pan. Spread spinach and cheese mixture into pan and fold overhanging dough over filling. Brush with oil, then layer remaining 4 sheets of phyllo dough, brushing each with oil. Tuck overhanging dough into pan to seal filling.
steps.s0004: Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, until golden brown. Cut into squares and serve while hot.

ingredients.i0004: 1 chipotle chile in adobo sauce, finely chopped

steps.s0001: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil grate. Place the ground turkey, onion, cilantro, chipotle chile pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, seasoned salt, and black pepper in a mixing bowl; mix well. Form into 4 patties.
steps.s0002: Cook the hamburgers on the preheated grill until the turkey is no longer pink in the center, about 4 minutes per side. Place the mozzarella slices on the patties 2 minutes before they are ready. Serve on the toasted buns.

ingredients.i0007: 2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined

steps.s0001: Preheat grill for medium heat.
steps.s0002: In a small bowl, crush the garlic with the salt. Mix in cayenne pepper and paprika, and then stir in olive oil and lemon juice to form a paste. In a large bowl, toss shrimp with garlic paste until evenly coated.
steps.s0003: Lightly oil grill grate. Cook shrimp for 2 to 3 minutes per side, or until opaque. Transfer to a serving dish, garnish with lemon wedges, and serve.

ingredients.i0009: 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root, peeled and minced
ingredients.i0012: 1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans (chickpeas), rinsed and drained

steps.s0001: Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until just tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two.
steps.s0002: Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the onion and garlic; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Season with cumin, cayenne pepper, curry powder, garam masala, ginger, and salt; cook for 2 minutes more. Add the tomatoes, garbanzo beans, peas, and potatoes. Pour in the coconut milk, and bring to a simmer. Simmer 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

ingredients.i0002: 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with garlic and onion

steps.s0001: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the tortellini, and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
steps.s0002: While you get the tortellini going, combine the tomatoes, spinach, salt, pepper, basil and garlic in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture begins to bubble.
steps.s0003: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, milk and cream. Stir this mixture into the saucepan along with the Parmesan cheese. Heat through, then reduce heat to low, and simmer until thick, about 2 minutes.
steps.s0004: Drain the tortellini, but do not rinse, then pour them into the saucepan with the sauce. Stir to coat, and serve.

ingredients.i0006: 1 (14.5 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, chopped

steps.s0001: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cut the tops off  the peppers, and remove the seeds. Cook peppers in boiling water for 5 minutes; drain. Sprinkle salt inside each pepper, and set aside.
steps.s0002: In a large skillet, saute beef and onions for 5 minutes, or until beef is browned. Drain off excess fat, and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the tomatoes, rice, 1/2 cup water and Worcestershire sauce. Cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until rice is tender. Remove from heat, and stir in the cheese.
steps.s0003: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. (175 degrees C). Stuff each pepper with the beef and rice mixture, and place peppers open side up in a baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine tomato soup with just enough water to make the soup a gravy consistency. Pour over the peppers.
steps.s0004: Bake covered for 25 to 35 minutes, until heated through and cheese is melted and bubbly.

ingredients.i0003: 2 green bell peppers, halved and seeded

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).  Lightly grease a baking sheet.
steps.s0002: In a medium saucepan, bring water to a boil. Stir in the rice. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat, and set aside.
steps.s0003: Place the peppers cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet. Roast 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until tender and skin starts to brown.
steps.s0004: While the peppers are roasting, heat oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the onions, basil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper in oil for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the tomato, and cook for 5 minutes. Spoon in the cooked rice, and stir until heated through. Remove from heat, mix in the feta cheese, and spoon the mixture into the pepper halves.
steps.s0005: Return to the oven for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
steps.s0003: In a large bowl, mix eggs, ricotta, half the mozzarella, half the Parmesan, parsley, salt and pepper until well combined. Stuff cooked shells with ricotta mixture and place in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
steps.s0004: In a medium bowl, stir together pasta sauce, mushrooms and reserved mozzarella and Parmesan. Pour over stuffed shells.
steps.s0005: Bake in preheated oven 45 to 60 minutes, until edges are bubbly and shells are slightly set.

ingredients.i0001: 1 pound pork butt, cut into 1 inch cubes
ingredients.i0010: 3 stalks celery, cut into 1/2 inch pieces
ingredients.i0011: 1 medium green bell pepper, cut into 1 inch pieces

steps.s0001: Place cubed pork in a medium bowl, and season with 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon sugar, and 1 teaspoon soy sauce. Mix in the egg white and green onions. Cover, and place in the refrigerator at least 1 hour.
steps.s0002: Heat 1 quart oil to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C) in a large, heavy saucepan or deep fryer.
steps.s0003: Coat the pork with 1/2 cup cornstarch, and fry in the heated oil about 10 minutes, until evenly browned. Drain on paper towels.
steps.s0004: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok over medium heat. Stir in the celery, green bell pepper, and onion, and cook until tender. Season with salt and sugar. Remove from heat, and set aside.
steps.s0005: In a large saucepan, mix 1 cup water, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 3/4 cup sugar, apple cider vinegar, ketchup, and 1/2 teaspoon soy sauce. Bring to a boil, and stir in the cooked pork, celery mixture, and the pineapple chunks with juice. Return to boil, and mix in 2 tablespoons cornstarch and 1/4 cup water to thicken. Cook until well blended.

ingredients.i0007: 1 1/2 tablespoons chopped Italian flat leaf parsley
ingredients.i0008: salt and ground black pepper to taste

steps.s0001: Combine beef, veal, and pork in a large bowl. Add garlic, eggs, cheese, parsley, salt and pepper.
steps.s0002: Blend bread crumbs into meat mixture. Slowly add the water 1/2 cup at a time. The mixture should be very moist but still hold its shape if rolled into meatballs. (I usually use about 1 1/4 cups of water). Shape into meatballs.
steps.s0003: Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Fry meatballs in batches. When the meatball is very brown and slightly crisp remove from the heat and drain on a paper towel. (If your mixture is too wet, cover the meatballs while they are cooking so that they hold their shape better.)

ingredients.i0010: 1/4 cup steak sauce, or more to taste

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 inch loaf pan.
steps.s0002: Combine milk and soft bread crumbs in a small bowl and allow to soften, about 5 minutes.
steps.s0003: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, salt, pepper, egg, 3 tablespoons steak sauce, chopped onion, and green bell pepper. Add bread crumb mixture, and mix with your hands until all ingredients are combined.
steps.s0004: Pat the the mixture into the prepared loaf pan. Brush the top with additional steak sauce.
steps.s0005: Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until done. Allow to stand 5 minutes before slicing.

steps.s0001: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add fettuccini and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
steps.s0002: In a large saucepan, melt butter into cream over low heat. Add salt, pepper and garlic salt.  Stir in cheese over medium heat until melted; this will thicken the sauce.
steps.s0003: Add pasta to sauce. Use enough of the pasta so that all of the sauce is used and the pasta is thoroughly coated. Serve immediately.

ingredients.i0013: 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, divided, or to taste

steps.s0001: In a Dutch oven, cook sausage, ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until well browned. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and water. Season with sugar, basil, fennel seeds, Italian seasoning, 1 teaspoon salt, pepper, and 2 tablespoons parsley. Simmer, covered, for about 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.
steps.s0002: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook lasagna noodles in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes. Drain noodles, and rinse with cold water.  In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese with egg, remaining parsley, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
steps.s0003: Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C).
steps.s0004: To assemble, spread 1 1/2 cups of meat sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.  Arrange 6 noodles lengthwise over meat sauce. Spread with one half of the ricotta cheese mixture. Top with a third of mozzarella cheese slices. Spoon 1 1/2 cups meat sauce over mozzarella, and sprinkle with 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese.  Repeat layers, and top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Cover with foil: to prevent sticking, either spray foil with cooking spray, or make sure the foil does not touch the cheese.
steps.s0005: Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil, and bake an additional 25 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes before serving.

r0250.title: Annie's Fruit Salsa and Cinnamon Chips

ingredients.i0002: 2 Golden Delicious apples - peeled, cored and diced

steps.s0001: In a large bowl, thoroughly mix kiwis, Golden Delicious apples, raspberries, strawberries, white sugar, brown sugar and fruit preserves. Cover and chill in the refrigerator at least 15 minutes.
steps.s0002: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0003: Coat one side of each flour tortilla with butter flavored cooking spray. Cut into wedges and arrange in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Sprinkle wedges with desired amount of cinnamon sugar. Spray again with cooking spray.
steps.s0004: Bake in the preheated oven 8 to 10 minutes. Repeat with any remaining tortilla wedges. Allow to cool approximately 15 minutes. Serve with chilled fruit mixture.

ingredients.i0001: 2 (10 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent dinner rolls
ingredients.i0007: 1 (12 ounce) jar roasted red peppers, drained, cut into thin strips

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 C).
steps.s0002: Unroll one package of crescent roll dough, and cover the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Layer the ham, provolone cheese, Swiss cheese, salami, pepperoni, and red peppers, on top of the dough.
steps.s0003: In a bowl, beat the eggs lightly, and stir in the parmesan cheese and black pepper. Pour 3/4 of this mixture over the peppers. Unroll the second package of dough, and place over the top of the peppers. Brush with the remaining egg mixture. Cover with aluminum foil.
steps.s0004: Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove foil, and bake another 10 to 20 minutes, or until dough is fluffy and golden brown. Cut into squares. Serve warm, or at room temperature.

ingredients.i0001: 1 pound sliced bacon, cut in half
ingredients.i0002: 1 (6 ounce) can crabmeat, drained and flaked

steps.s0001: Preheat the broiler.
steps.s0002: Spread the bacon on a large baking sheet. Place a small mound of crabmeat at one end of each half slice of bacon. Roll bacon around the crabmeat, securing with toothpicks, if necessary.
steps.s0003: Broil the rolled bacon 10 minutes, turning it once to ensure even browning, until evenly crisp and browned. Drain on paper towels and serve warm with duck sauce.

ingredients.i0002: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
ingredients.i0003: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Place garlic in a small baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven 20 to 30  minutes, until soft. Remove from heat. When cool enough to touch, squeeze softened garlic from skins.
steps.s0003: In an 8x8 inch baking dish, spread the roasted garlic, spinach, artichoke hearts, Alfredo-style pasta sauce, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, and cream cheese.
steps.s0004: Bake in the preheated oven 30 minutes, or until cheeses are melted and bubbly. Serve warm.

ingredients.i0001: 16 Boston Bibb or butter lettuce leaves
ingredients.i0010: 1 dash Asian chile pepper sauce, or to taste (optional)
ingredients.i0011: 1 (8 ounce) can water chestnuts, drained and finely chopped

steps.s0001: Rinse whole lettuce leaves and pat dry, being careful not tear them. Set aside.
steps.s0002: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef and cooking oil in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease; transfer beef to a bowl. Cook and stir onion in the same skillet used for beef until slightly tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir hoisin sauce, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, ginger, and chile pepper sauce into onions. Add water chestnuts, green onions, sesame oil, and cooked beef; cook and stir until the onions just begin to wilt, about 2 minutes.
steps.s0003: Arrange lettuce leaves around the outer edge of a large serving platter and pile meat mixture in the center.

ingredients.i0002: 1 ripe avocado - peeled, pitted and chopped
ingredients.i0008: 1 tablespoon red or white wine vinegar

steps.s0001: In a bowl, gently stir together tomatoes, avocados, onion, and garlic. Mix in parsley and oregano. Gently stir in olive oil and vinegar. Then stir in feta. Cover, and chill for 2 to 6 hours.

In a medium bowl, combine the mango, avocado, tomatoes, jalapeno, cilantro, and garlic. Stir in the salt, lime juice, red onion, and olive oil. To blend the flavors, refrigerate for about 30 minutes before serving.
Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain on paper towels.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, combine mayonnaise and sour cream. Crumble bacon into the sour cream and mayonnaise mixture. Mix in tomatoes just before serving.

ingredients.i0002: 2 (16 ounce) packages frozen sweet corn, thawed
ingredients.i0005: 2 jalapeno peppers, diced, or more to taste
ingredients.i0006: 1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
ingredients.i0007: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste

steps.s0001: Cook bacon in a 10-inch cast iron skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until almost crisp and fat is rendered, 7 to 8 minutes.
steps.s0002: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
steps.s0003: Drain frozen corn thoroughly in a colander. Add 1/2 of the corn to the skillet with the bacon. Cook and stir until kernels just start to turn golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic, green onions, and jalapenos; cook until vegetables start to soften and sweeten up, 3 to 4 minutes. Tilt pan to drain off some of the fat, using a paper towel to soak it up.
steps.s0004: Season with salt, pepper, and cayenne. Pour in cream; stir and bring to a boil. Stir in the remaining corn until heated through. Turn off the heat and add about 2/3 of the mozzarella and Monterey Jack cheese. Stir to combine. Top corn with remaining cheese and a sprinkle of cayenne.
steps.s0005: Broil until heated through and top is browned, 5 to 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

steps.s0001: Place eggs in a saucepan, and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat. Cover, and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from hot water, and cool. To cool more quickly, rinse eggs under cold running water.
steps.s0002: Meanwhile, place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Alternatively, wrap bacon in paper towels and cook in the microwave for about 1 minute per slice. Crumble and set aside.
steps.s0003: Peel the hard-cooked eggs, and cut in half lengthwise. Remove yolks to a small bowl. Mash egg yolks with mayonnaise, crumbled bacon and cheese. Stir in mustard. Fill egg white halves with the yolk mixture and refrigerate until serving.

ingredients.i0001: 1 pound sliced bacon, cut into thirds
ingredients.i0003: 3/4 cup brown sugar, or to taste

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Refrigerate 2/3 of the bacon until needed. It is easier to wrap the wieners with cold bacon. Wrap each cocktail wiener with a piece of bacon and secure with a toothpick. Place on a large baking sheet. Sprinkle brown sugar generously over all.
steps.s0003: Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until the sugar is bubbly. To serve, place the wieners in a slow cooker and keep on the low setting.

ingredients.i0009: 1 loaf French bread, toasted and sliced

steps.s0001: In a bowl, toss together the tomatoes, basil, Parmesan cheese, and garlic. Mix in the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, kosher salt, and pepper. Serve on toasted bread slices.

ingredients.i0004: 12 ounces jalapeno peppers, seeded and halved

steps.s0001: In a medium bowl, mix the cream cheese, Cheddar cheese and bacon bits. Spoon this mixture into the jalapeno pepper halves.
steps.s0002: Put the milk and flour into two separate small bowls. Dip the stuffed jalapenos first into the milk then into the flour, making sure they are well coated with each. Allow the coated jalapenos to dry for about 10 minutes.
steps.s0003: Dip the jalapenos in milk again and roll them through the breadcrumbs. Allow them to dry, then repeat to ensure  the entire surface of the jalapeno is coated.
steps.s0004: In a medium skillet, heat the oil to 365 degrees F ( 180 degrees C). Deep fry the coated jalapenos 2 to 3 minutes each, until golden brown. Remove and let drain on a paper towel.

ingredients.i0003: 1 (1.8 ounce) package dry leek soup mix
ingredients.i0004: 1 (4 ounce) can water chestnuts, drained and chopped
ingredients.i0005: 1/2 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

steps.s0001: In a medium bowl, mix together mayonnaise, sour cream, dry leek soup mix, water chestnuts and chopped spinach. Chill in the refrigerator 6 hours, or overnight.
steps.s0002: Remove top and interior of sourdough bread. Fill with mayonnaise mixture. Tear removed bread chunks into pieces for dipping.

steps.s0001: Cook bacon strips in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy; drain on paper towels. While the bacon is cooking, remove stems from mushrooms. Set caps aside, and chop stems.
steps.s0002: Add butter to skillet with bacon grease. When melted, stir in mushroom stems, onion, and garlic. Cook, stirring frequently until the onions caramelize, 15 to 20 minutes.
steps.s0003: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a small baking dish with cooking spray.
steps.s0004: Once the onion mixture has reached a deep, rich brown color, place into a blender along with bacon, cream cheese, blue cheese, and bread crumbs. Blend on low until ingredients are roughly chopped and evenly combined. Stuff cheese mixture into mushroom caps and place into prepared baking dish.
steps.s0005: Bake in preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned, 10 to 15 minutes.

ingredients.i0003: 1 cup brown sugar, or to taste

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Cut bacon into thirds and wrap each strip around a little sausage. Place the wrapped sausages on wooden skewers, several to a skewer. Arrange the skewers on a baking sheet and sprinkle them liberally with brown sugar.
steps.s0003: Bake until bacon is crisp and the brown sugar melted.

steps.s0001: In a medium bowl, beat together cream cheese and butter until smooth. Mix in confectioners' sugar, brown sugar and vanilla. Stir in chocolate chips. Cover, and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
steps.s0002: Shape chilled cream cheese mixture into a ball. Wrap with plastic, and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
steps.s0003: Roll the cheese ball in finely chopped pecans before serving.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, egg, water, bread crumbs, and minced onion. Roll into small meatballs.
steps.s0003: Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, turning once.
steps.s0004: In a slow cooker or large saucepan over low heat, blend the cranberry sauce, chili sauce, brown sugar, and lemon juice. Add meatballs, and simmer for 1 hour before serving.

steps.s0001: In medium bowl, combine egg, 1/2 cup flour, beer and baking powder. Place 1/4 cup flour and coconut in two separate bowls.
steps.s0002: Hold shrimp by tail, and dredge in flour, shaking off excess flour. Dip in egg/beer batter; allow excess to drip off. Roll shrimp in coconut, and place on a baking sheet lined with wax paper. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) in a deep-fryer.
steps.s0003: Fry shrimp in batches: cook, turning once, for 2 to 3 minutes, or until golden brown. Using tongs, remove shrimp to paper towels to drain. Serve warm with your favorite dipping sauce.

ingredients.i0002: 1 (14.5 ounce) can whole berry cranberry sauce
ingredients.i0005: 2 drops hot sauce (such as Tabasco®), or more to taste

steps.s0001: Place frozen meatballs into a slow cooker. Add cranberry sauce, chili sauce, lemon juice, and hot sauce. Stir to distribute sauce evenly over meatballs.
steps.s0002: Cook on High until meatballs are completely thawed and hot, about 3 hours.

ingredients.i0006: 1/4 cup canned sliced green chiles, or to taste

steps.s0001: Place the tomatoes, onion, garlic, lime juice, salt, green chiles, and cilantro in a blender or food processor. Blend on low to desired consistency.

Place eggs in a pot; pour enough water over the eggs to cover. Cover and turn stove to high; bring to a boil; turn off heat and place pot on a cool burner. Let the pot sit with the cover on for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, fill a large bowl halfway with cold water; transfer the eggs from the pot to the cold water. Replace the water with cold water as needed to keep cold until the eggs are completely cooled. Chill in refrigerator at least 2 hours before peeling.

ingredients.i0002: 1/2 cup sun-dried tomatoes, packed in oil

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven on broiler setting.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, combine the roma tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, vinegar, basil, salt, and pepper. Allow the mixture to sit for 10 minutes.
steps.s0003: Cut the baguette into 3/4-inch slices. On a baking sheet, arrange the baguette slices in a single layer. Broil for 1 to 2 minutes, until slightly brown.
steps.s0004: Divide the tomato mixture evenly over the baguette slices. Top the slices with mozzarella cheese.
steps.s0005: Broil for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.

ingredients.i0001: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach - thawed, drained and squeezed dry
ingredients.i0002: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 7x11 inch baking dish.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, mix together the cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth.  Mix in the artichoke hearts, spinach and Parmesan cheese. Season with garlic and lemon juice. Spread evenly into the prepared baking dish.
steps.s0003: Bake covered for 20 minutes. Remove the cover, and let the dish bake uncovered for 5 more minutes, or until the surface is lightly browned.

steps.s0001: In a small bowl, mix the eggs and water.
steps.s0002: Mix the bread crumbs and garlic salt in a medium bowl. In a medium bowl, blend the flour and cornstarch.
steps.s0003: In a large heavy saucepan, heat the oil to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C).
steps.s0004: One at a time, coat each mozzarella stick in the flour mixture, then the egg mixture, then in the bread crumbs and finally into the oil. Fry until golden brown, about 30 seconds. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels.

steps.s0001: Using an electric mixer, blend cream cheese and marshmallow creme until mixed thoroughly.

ingredients.i0010: 2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined with tails attached

steps.s0001: In a mixing bowl, mix together olive oil, parsley, lemon juice, hot sauce, garlic, tomato paste, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Reserve a small amount for basting later. Pour remaining marinade into a large resealable plastic bag with shrimp. Seal, and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
steps.s0002: Preheat grill for medium-low heat. Thread shrimp onto skewers, piercing once near the tail and once near the head. Discard marinade.
steps.s0003: Lightly oil grill grate. Cook shrimp for 5 minutes per side, or until opaque, basting frequently with reserved marinade.

r0277.title: Hot Artichoke and Spinach Dip II

ingredients.i0009: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
ingredients.i0010: 1/2 cup frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a small baking dish.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, mix together cream cheese, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, Romano cheese, garlic, basil, garlic salt, salt and pepper. Gently stir in artichoke hearts and spinach.
steps.s0003: Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake in the preheated oven 25 minutes, until bubbly and lightly browned.

steps.s0001: In a small bowl, mix together the cream cheese, oregano, parsley, and basil.
steps.s0002: Spread mixture in the bottom of a 9 inch pie plate, or a shallow microwave-safe dish. Sprinkle 1/2 cup of the mozzarella cheese and 1/2 cup of the Parmesan cheese on top of the cream cheese mixture. Spread the pizza sauce over all. Sprinkle with remaining cheese, then top with green pepper, pepperoni and olive slices. Cover, and microwave for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

steps.s0001: Place the garbanzo beans, tahini, lemon juice, salt and garlic in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Transfer mixture to a serving bowl.
steps.s0002: Drizzle olive oil over the garbanzo bean mixture. Sprinkle with paprika and parsley.

ingredients.i0003: 1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies, drained
ingredients.i0004: 2 ounces canned diced jalapeno peppers, drained

steps.s0001: Stir together cream cheese and mayonnaise in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in green chiles and jalapeno peppers. Pour mixture into a microwave safe serving dish, and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
steps.s0002: Microwave on High until hot, about 3 minutes.

steps.s0001: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Once hot, stir in the sugar and popcorn. Cover, and shake the pot constantly to keep the sugar from burning. Once the popping has slowed to once every 2 to 3 seconds, remove the pot from the heat and continue to shake for a few minutes until the popping has stopped. Pour into a large bowl, and allow to cool, stirring occasionally to break up large clumps.

ingredients.i0001: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
ingredients.i0002: 1/2 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a small baking dish, mix together artichoke hearts, spinach, sour cream, mayonnaise, cream cheese, Romano cheese, and garlic. Cover dish.
steps.s0003: Bake until heated through and bubbly, about 25 minutes.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Clean mushrooms with a damp paper towel.  Carefully break off stems.  Chop stems extremely fine, discarding tough end of stems.
steps.s0002: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and chopped mushroom stems to the skillet. Fry until any moisture has disappeared, taking care not to burn garlic.  Set aside to cool.
steps.s0003: When garlic and mushroom mixture is no longer hot, stir in cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, black pepper, onion powder and cayenne pepper.  Mixture should be very thick. Using a little spoon, fill each mushroom cap with a generous amount of stuffing. Arrange the mushroom caps on prepared cookie sheet.
steps.s0004: Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the mushrooms are piping hot and liquid starts to form under caps.

ingredients.i0002: 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour, or as needed

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking tray with parchment paper and dust lightly with flour.
steps.s0002: Lay puff pastry on a flat work surface; cut a 12-inch circle from each sheet. Transfer 1 circle to the prepared baking sheet.
steps.s0003: Spread ricotta evenly over the pastry circle. Top with an even layer of pesto. Lay the second pastry circle on top. Set a small glass upside down in the middle of the circle.
steps.s0004: Cut the circle, away from the glass, into 4 equal quarters. Cut each quarter in half, then each eighth in half, to make 16 equal strips. Remove glass. Twist strips twice, two at a time, in the opposite direction. Pinch ends together. Repeat with remaining strips to make a pinwheel shape.
steps.s0005: Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is browned, 25 to 30 minutes.

ingredients.i0006: 1/2 clove garlic, minced, or more to taste
ingredients.i0007: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
ingredients.i0008: salt and ground black pepper to taste
ingredients.i0009: 1 cup whole almonds, or as needed

steps.s0001: Stir cream cheese, goat cheese, parsley, tarragon, thyme, garlic, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth and well-mixed.
steps.s0002: Turn cheese mixture out onto a serving platter and form into a tapered oval shape to resemble a pine cone.
steps.s0003: Starting at the tapered end, press almonds into the cheese cone so that the tip of the almond is facing out and down, and cheese cone is completely covered with almonds and resembles a pine cone. Place rosemary sprigs at the top to resemble pine needles.

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Generously grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, mix together the oats, brown sugar, wheat germ, cinnamon, flour, raisins and salt. Make a well in the center, and pour in the honey, egg, oil and vanilla. Mix well using your hands. Pat the mixture evenly into the prepared pan.
steps.s0003: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until the bars begin to turn golden at the edges. Cool for 5 minutes, then cut into bars while still warm. Do not allow the bars to cool completely before cutting, or they will be too hard to cut.

ingredients.i0001: 1 (16 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed
ingredients.i0002: 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix

steps.s0001: In a large bowl, mix together instant vanilla pudding mix, pumpkin and pumpkin pie spice. Fold in the thawed frozen whipped topping. Chill in the refrigerator until serving.
Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In one small bowl, stir together the bread crumbs, pepper and Parmesan cheese. Place the egg whites in a separate bowl. Dip zucchini slices into the egg whites, then coat the breadcrumb mixture. Place on a greased baking sheet.
steps.s0003: Bake for 5 minutes in the preheated oven, then turn over and bake for another 5 to 10 minutes, until browned and crispy.

ingredients.i0002: 1 (19 ounce) can garbanzo beans, half the liquid reserved

steps.s0001: In a blender, chop the garlic. Pour garbanzo beans into the blender, reserving about a tablespoon for garnish. Add reserved liquid, lemon juice, tahini, and salt to the blender. Blend until creamy and well mixed.
steps.s0002: Transfer the mixture to a medium serving bowl. Sprinkle with pepper and pour olive oil over the top. Garnish with reserved garbanzo beans.

r0290.title: Roasted Grape Crostini with Fresh Herbs

ingredients.i0002: 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided, or as needed
ingredients.i0005: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
ingredients.i0009: 1 tablespoon balsamic glaze, or to taste (optional)

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and set aside.
steps.s0002: Toss grapes, 1 tablespoon olive oil, thyme, and oregano together in a medium bowl. Spread grapes out evenly on the prepared baking sheet and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
steps.s0003: Bake in the preheated oven until grapes are tender and their skins start to wrinkle, 12 to 15 minutes.
steps.s0004: Meanwhile, brush baguette slices lightly with remaining olive oil and place on another baking sheet.
steps.s0005: Toast in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove grape mixture and crostini from the oven and let cool slightly.
steps.s0006: Mix ricotta cheese and lemon zest together in a bowl. Spread onto each crostini and top with grape mixture. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Toss seeds in a bowl with the melted butter and salt. Spread the seeds in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for about 45 minutes or until golden brown; stir occasionally.

ingredients.i0010: 1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained

steps.s0001: In a medium bowl, blend the taco seasoning mix and refried beans. Spread the mixture onto a large serving platter.
steps.s0002: Mix the sour cream and cream cheese in a medium bowl. Spread over the refried beans.
steps.s0003: Top the layers with salsa. Place a layer of tomato, green bell pepper, green onions and lettuce over the salsa, and top with Cheddar cheese. Garnish with black olives.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a medium baking dish, mix together Cheddar cheese, Parmesan cheese, artichoke hearts, green onions, garlic salt, mayonnaise and shrimp. Sprinkle with paprika.
steps.s0003: Bake in the preheated oven 20 minutes, or until bubbly and lightly browned.

ingredients.i0009: salt and black pepper to taste

steps.s0001: Place the Cheddar cheese, cream cheese, mayonnaise, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, onion powder, minced jalapeno, and pimento into the large bowl of a mixer. Beat at medium speed, with paddle if possible, until thoroughly combined. Season to taste with salt and black pepper.
Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Combine the margarine, salt, garlic salt, Worcestershire sauce and pumpkin seeds. Mix thoroughly and place in shallow baking dish.
steps.s0003: Bake for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.

ingredients.i0002: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
ingredients.i0003: 1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained

steps.s0001: In a medium bowl, combine black-eyed peas, black beans, corn, onion, green bell pepper, jalapeno peppers and tomatoes. Season with Italian-style salad dressing and garlic salt; mix well. Cover, and refrigerate overnight to blend flavors.

ingredients.i0001: 1 (10 ounce) package spinach, rinsed and chopped

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
steps.s0002: Place spinach in a medium saucepan with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer and cook until spinach is limp, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat, drain, and set aside.
steps.s0003: In a large bowl, mix flour, salt and baking powder. Stir in eggs, milk and butter. Mix in spinach, onion and mozzarella cheese.
steps.s0004: Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool before serving.

ingredients.i0001: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
ingredients.i0002: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).  Lightly grease a 1 quart baking dish.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, mix together artichoke hearts, spinach, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese and 2 cups  Monterey Jack cheese. Transfer mixture to the prepared baking dish, and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of Monterey Jack cheese.
steps.s0003: Bake in the center of the preheated oven until the cheese is melted, about 15 minutes.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Grease one baking sheet.
steps.s0002: In a mixing bowl, whip together the egg white and water until frothy. In a separate bowl, mix together sugar, salt, and cinnamon.
steps.s0003: Add pecans to egg whites, stir to coat the nuts evenly. Remove the nuts, and toss them in the sugar mixture until coated. Spread the nuts out on the prepared baking sheet.
steps.s0004: Bake at 250 degrees F (120 degrees C) for 1 hour. Stir every 15 minutes.

ingredients.i0001: 10 cups all-purpose apples, peeled, cored and sliced

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degree C).
steps.s0002: Place the sliced apples in a 9x13 inch pan. Mix the white sugar, 1 tablespoon flour and ground cinnamon together, and sprinkle over apples. Pour water evenly over all.
steps.s0003: Combine the oats, 1 cup flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda and melted butter together. Crumble evenly over the apple mixture.
steps.s0004: Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 45 minutes.

ingredients.i0001: 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie
ingredients.i0007: 8 Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and sliced

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Melt the butter in a saucepan. Stir in flour to form a paste. Add water, white sugar and brown sugar, and bring to a boil. Reduce temperature and let simmer.
steps.s0002: Place the bottom crust in your pan. Fill with apples, mounded slightly. Cover with a lattice work crust.  Gently pour the sugar and butter liquid over the crust.  Pour slowly so that it does not run off.
steps.s0003: Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Continue baking for 35 to 45 minutes, until apples are soft.

r0302.title: Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies

ingredients.i0006: 2 (3.4 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together the flour and baking soda, set aside.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar. Beat in the instant pudding mix until blended. Stir in the eggs and vanilla. Blend in the flour mixture. Finally, stir in the chocolate chips and nuts. Drop cookies by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
steps.s0003: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Edges should be golden brown.

ingredients.i0003: 1 (5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix
ingredients.i0006: 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed

steps.s0001: In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Beat in condensed milk, pudding mix, cold milk and vanilla until smooth.  Fold in 1/2 of the whipped topping.
steps.s0002: Line the bottom of a 9x13 inch dish with vanilla wafers. Arrange sliced bananas evenly over wafers. Spread with pudding mixture. Top with remaining whipped topping. Chill.

r0304.title: Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper.
steps.s0002: Sift together the flour, baking soda and salt; set aside.
steps.s0003: In a medium bowl, cream together the melted butter, brown sugar and white sugar until well blended. Beat in the vanilla, egg, and egg yolk until light and creamy. Mix in the sifted ingredients until just blended. Stir in the chocolate chips by hand using a wooden spoon. Drop cookie dough 1/4 cup at a time onto the prepared cookie sheets. Cookies should be about 3 inches apart.
steps.s0004: Bake for 15 to 17 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are lightly toasted. Cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan.
steps.s0002: In a large saucepan, melt 1/2 cup butter. Remove from heat, and stir in sugar, eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat in 1/3 cup cocoa, 1/2 cup flour, salt, and baking powder. Spread batter into prepared pan.
steps.s0003: Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes. Do not overcook.
steps.s0004: To Make Frosting:  Combine 3 tablespoons softened butter, 3 tablespoons cocoa, honey, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and 1 cup confectioners' sugar. Stir until smooth. Frost brownies while they are still warm.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Dissolve baking soda in hot water.  Add to batter along with salt. Stir in flour, chocolate chips, and nuts. Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans.
steps.s0003: Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are nicely browned.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, cream together the butter, butter flavored shortening, brown sugar, white sugar, eggs, and vanilla until smooth. Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, and salt; stir into the sugar mixture. Stir in the oats and raisins. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
steps.s0003: Bake 10 to 12 minutes until light and golden. Do not overbake. Let them cool for 2 minutes before removing from cookie sheets to cool completely. Store in airtight container. Make sure you get some, because they don't last long!

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together the flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, and salt. Set aside.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg, then stir in the water and molasses. Gradually stir the sifted ingredients into the molasses mixture. Shape dough into walnut sized balls, and roll them in the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar. Place the cookies 2 inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet, and flatten slightly.
steps.s0003: Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9 inch round cake pans or one 9x13 inch pan.
steps.s0002: In large bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa,  baking soda, baking powder and salt. Make a well in the center.
steps.s0003: Add eggs, coffee, buttermilk, oil and vanilla. Beat for 2 minutes on medium speed. Batter will be thin. Pour into prepared pans.
steps.s0004: Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 40 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes, then remove from pans and finish cooling on a wire rack. Fill and frost as desired.

steps.s0001: In a medium bowl, stir together the sugar, light cream, half-and-half and black walnut extract. Pour into the container of an ice cream maker, and freeze according to the manufacturer's instructions. When ice cream is done, fold in walnuts, and transfer to a freezer container. Freeze until solid.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan.
steps.s0002: Measure 1 cup sifted flour. Add baking powder, baking soda, and salt.  Sift again. Add 1/2 cup chopped nuts. Mix well and set aside.
steps.s0003: Stir the brown sugar into the melted butter and mix well. Cool slightly.
steps.s0004: Mix the beaten egg and vanilla into the brown sugar mixture. Add flour mixture, a little at a time, mixing just until combined.
steps.s0005: Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Sprinkle 1/2 to 1 cup chocolate chips on top.  Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 20 to 25 minutes.

ingredients.i0006: 1/2 cup cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
ingredients.i0015: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces

steps.s0001: Lightly grease a 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom.
steps.s0002: Combine flour, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt in a food processor. Pulse a few times to combine. Add cold butter and pulse several more times until the mixture resembles coarse sand; mixture will be very crumbly. Pour mixture into the prepared tart pan. Use damp hands to press crumbs together evenly along the bottom and up the sides of the pan to form a crust. Use a fork to gently prick the bottom of the crust several times. Place crust in the freezer for 15 minutes.
steps.s0003: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0004: Remove crust from freezer and place it on a cookie sheet. Line the crust with aluminum foil and fill with dried beans.
steps.s0005: Bake in the preheated oven until crust begins to turn golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove beans and aluminum foil. Return crust to the oven and bake until center of crust is set, 5 to 7 minutes more. Remove from oven and reduce heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
steps.s0006: Meanwhile whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a large heat-safe bowl. Mix in blood orange juice, eggs, egg yolk, and zest until smooth. Bring a pot of water to a low simmer. Place bowl with blood orange mixture over the pot of simmering water, making sure bowl does not touch water. Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove bowl from heat and stir in butter a piece at a time, ensuring each piece melts before adding the next. Pour custard mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into the prepared crust.
steps.s0007: Bake in the preheated oven until custard is set, 15 to 20 minutes. Allow tart to cool to room temperature before removing from pan, about 30 minutes.
steps.s0008: Chill tart for about 3 hours. Top with blood orange slices before serving.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Break bread into small pieces into an 8 inch square baking pan. Drizzle melted butter or margarine over bread. If desired, sprinkle with raisins.
steps.s0003: In a medium mixing bowl, combine eggs, milk, sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla. Beat until well mixed. Pour over bread, and lightly push down with a fork until bread is covered and soaking up the egg mixture.
steps.s0004: Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until the top springs back when lightly tapped.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 baking dish.
steps.s0002: Combine the melted butter, sugar, and vanilla in a large bowl. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each, until thoroughly blended.
steps.s0003: Sift the flour, cocoa powder, and salt in a bowl. Gradually stir flour mixture into the egg mixture until blended. Stir in the chocolate morsels. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared baking dish.
steps.s0004: Bake in preheated oven until an inserted toothpick comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes. Remove, and cool pan on wire rack before cutting.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).  Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, beat together eggs, oil, white sugar and 2 teaspoons vanilla. Mix in flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and cinnamon. Stir in carrots. Fold in pecans.  Pour into prepared pan.
steps.s0003: Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.
steps.s0004: To Make Frosting:  In a medium bowl, combine butter, cream cheese, confectioners' sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Stir in chopped pecans. Frost the cooled cake.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch springform pan.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, mix graham cracker crumbs with melted butter. Press onto bottom of springform pan.
steps.s0003: In a large bowl, mix cream cheese with sugar until smooth. Blend in milk, and then mix in the eggs one at a time, mixing just enough to incorporate. Mix in sour cream, vanilla and flour until smooth. Pour filling into prepared crust.
steps.s0004: Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Turn the oven off, and let cake cool in oven with the door closed for 5 to 6 hours; this prevents cracking. Chill in refrigerator until serving.

r0317.title: Cheesecake with Cranberry Glaze and Sugared Cranberries

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease the sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Line the bottom with a circle of parchment paper.
steps.s0002: Crush biscuits into crumbs using a food processor. Stir crumbs, butter, confectioners' sugar, and salt together to make the crust. Press into the bottom of the pan. Rinse food processor and set aside for the cranberry glaze.
steps.s0003: Bake crust in the preheated oven until firm, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove the crust from the oven and reduce the temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Let crust cool while making the filling.
steps.s0004: Beat cream cheese and sugar together until smooth. Add eggs, sour cream, vanilla, and orange zest. Mix until well combined, stopping to scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl. Spoon batter over the crust.
steps.s0005: Bake until the filling is set but still soft in the center, 30 to 40 minutes. Cool cheesecake to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
steps.s0006: While the cheesecake is cooling, combine 1/3 cup sugar and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat and stir until sugar is dissolved. Pour into a bowl and cool for 10 minutes. Add cranberries and stir to coat with syrup.
steps.s0007: Refrigerate cheesecake and syrup-coated cranberries, 8 hours to overnight.
steps.s0008: Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Place 1/4 cup granulated sugar in a shallow bowl. Drain the cranberries, then roll them in the sugar. Place the sugared cranberries on the prepared baking sheet and allow to dry, 30 minutes to 1 hour.
steps.s0009: In the meantime, make the glaze. Combine cranberries, water, and sugar in a small saucepan. Simmer, crushing cranberries, until jammy, about 8 minutes. Let cool slightly. Transfer to the food processor; add confectioners' sugar, orange juice, corn syrup, vanilla, and salt. Process until smooth.
steps.s0010: Strain cranberry glaze through a fine-mesh sieve and discard solids. Pour over the cheesecake and smooth across the top with a small offset spatula. Garnish with sugared cranberries.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In large bowl, beat butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla until light and fluffy. Combine the flour, cocoa, baking soda, and salt; stir into the butter mixture until well blended. Mix in the chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
steps.s0003: Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or just until set. Cool slightly on the cookie sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

steps.s0001: Cream butter, peanut butter, and sugars together in a bowl; beat in eggs.
steps.s0002: In a separate bowl, sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; stir into butter mixture. Put dough in refrigerator for 1 hour.
steps.s0003: Roll dough into 1 inch balls and put on baking sheets. Flatten each ball with a fork, making a crisscross pattern. Bake in a preheated 375 degrees F oven for about 10 minutes or until cookies begin to brown.

ingredients.i0001: 2 large Granny Smith apples, peeled and cored
ingredients.i0002: 2 (10 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent roll dough
ingredients.i0006: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle Mountain Dew ™

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
steps.s0002: Cut each apple into 8 wedges and set aside. Separate the crescent roll dough into triangles. Roll each apple wedge in crescent roll dough starting at the smallest end. Pinch to seal and place in the baking dish.
steps.s0003: Melt butter in a small saucepan and stir in the sugar and cinnamon. Pour over the apple dumplings. Pour Mountain Dew(TM) over the dumplings.
steps.s0004: Bake for 35 to 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).  Lightly grease 2 cookie sheets.
steps.s0002: Cream together sugar and butter.  Beat in egg yolks and vanilla.
steps.s0003: Add  flour, baking soda, and cream of tartar. Stir.
steps.s0004: Form dough into walnut size balls and place 2 inches apart on cookie sheet. Don't flatten.  Bake 10 to 11 minutes, until tops are cracked and just turning color.

steps.s0001: Bring 1 1/2  cups water to a boil in a saucepan; stir rice into boiling water. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
steps.s0002: In a clean saucepan, combine 1 1/2 cups cooked rice, 1 1/2 cups milk, sugar and salt. Cook over medium heat until thick and creamy, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup milk, beaten egg, and raisins; cook 2 minutes more, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Blend in eggs one at a time. Remove 1 cup of batter and spread into bottom of crust; set aside.
steps.s0003: Add pumpkin, cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg to the remaining batter and stir gently until well blended. Carefully spread over the batter in the crust.
steps.s0004: Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until center is almost set. Allow to cool, then refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. Cover with whipped topping before serving.

ingredients.i0007: 2 cups of sliced fresh peaches or nectarines, or whole blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, blackberries or a combination of fruits (or a 12-ounce package of frozen berries)

steps.s0001: Adjust oven rack to upper-middle position, and heat oven to 350 degrees.
steps.s0002: Put butter in an 8-inch square or 9-inch round pan; set in oven to melt. When butter has melted, remove pan from oven.
steps.s0003: Whisk flour, 3/4 cup of sugar, baking powder and salt in small bowl. Add milk; whisk to form a smooth batter. Pour batter into pan, then scatter fruit over batter. Sprinkle with remaining 1 Tb. of sugar.
steps.s0004: Bake until batter browns and fruit bubbles, 50 to 60 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature with a dollop of whipped cream or a small scoop of vanilla ice cream, if desired.

ingredients.i0001: 1 (16 ounce) package OREO Chocolate Sandwich Cookies, divided
ingredients.i0002: 1 (8 ounce) package PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened
ingredients.i0003: 2 (8 ounce) packages BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Baking Chocolate, melted

steps.s0001: Crush 9 of the cookies to fine crumbs in food processor; reserve for later use. (Cookies can also be finely crushed in a resealable plastic bag using a rolling pin.) Crush remaining 36 cookies to fine crumbs; place in medium bowl. Add cream cheese; mix until well blended. Roll cookie mixture into 42 balls, about 1-inch in diameter.
steps.s0002: Dip balls in chocolate; place on wax paper-covered baking sheet. (Any leftover chocolate can be stored at room temperature for another use.) Sprinkle with reserved cookie crumbs.
steps.s0003: Refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour. Store leftover truffles, covered, in refrigerator.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a small bowl, stir together flour, baking soda, and baking powder. Set aside.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg and vanilla. Gradually blend in the dry ingredients. Roll rounded teaspoonfuls of dough into balls, and place onto ungreased cookie sheets.
steps.s0003: Bake 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden. Let stand on cookie sheet two minutes before removing to cool on wire racks.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9 inch cake pans.
steps.s0002: Use the first set of ingredients to make the cake. In a medium bowl, stir together the sugar, flour, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Add the eggs, milk, oil and vanilla, mix for 3 minutes with an electric mixer. Stir in the boiling water by hand. Pour evenly into the two prepared pans.
steps.s0003: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to cool completely.
steps.s0004: To make the frosting, use the second set of ingredients. Cream butter until light and fluffy. Stir in the cocoa and confectioners' sugar alternately with the milk and vanilla. Beat to a spreading consistency.
steps.s0005: Split the layers of cooled cake horizontally, cover the top of each layer with frosting, then stack them onto a serving plate. Frost the outside of the cake.

ingredients.i0001: 8 fresh peaches - peeled, pitted and sliced into thin wedges
ingredients.i0013: 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, chilled and cut into small pieces

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, combine peaches, 1/4 cup  white sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice, and cornstarch. Toss to coat evenly, and pour into a 2 quart baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
steps.s0003: Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine flour, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar, baking powder, and salt. Blend in butter with your fingertips, or a pastry blender, until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in water until just combined.
steps.s0004: Remove peaches from oven, and drop spoonfuls of topping over them. Sprinkle entire cobbler with the sugar and cinnamon mixture. Bake until topping is golden, about 30 minutes.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a jelly roll pan.
steps.s0002: Beat pumpkin, white sugar, vegetable oil, and eggs together in a large mixing bowl. Combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, and salt in a sifter; sift into the pumpkin mixture and mix well; pour into the prepared pan.
steps.s0003: Bake in preheated oven until center springs back when lightly touched, 35 to 40 minutes. Cool completely before frosting.
steps.s0004: Beat cream cheese and butter together in a bowl until smooth; add vanilla extract and beat. Gradually beat confectioners' sugar into the frosting, adding in small amounts and assuring each batch is incorporated before introducing the next. Spread over the pumpkin bars.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ground cloves, and salt; set aside.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, cream together the 1/2 cup of  butter and white sugar. Add pumpkin, egg, and 1 teaspoon vanilla to butter mixture, and beat until creamy. Mix in dry ingredients. Drop on cookie sheet by tablespoonfuls; flatten slightly.
steps.s0003: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool cookies, then drizzle glaze with fork.
steps.s0004: To Make Glaze: Combine confectioners' sugar, milk, 1 tablespoon melted butter, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Add milk as needed, to achieve drizzling consistency.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, combine condensed milk, sour cream, lime juice, and lime rind. Mix well and pour into graham cracker crust.
steps.s0003: Bake in preheated oven for 5 to 8 minutes, until tiny pinhole bubbles burst on the surface of pie. DO NOT BROWN! Chill pie thoroughly before serving. Garnish with lime slices and whipped cream if desired.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl, mix together the crushed gingersnap cookies, pecans, and butter. Press into the bottom, and about 1 inch up the sides of a 9 inch springform pan. Bake crust 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Set aside to cool.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, mix together the cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, and vanilla just until smooth. Mix in eggs one at a time, blending well after each. Set aside 1 cup of the mixture. Blend 1/4 cup sugar, pumpkin, cinnamon, and nutmeg into the remaining mixture.
steps.s0003: Spread the pumpkin flavored batter into the crust, and drop the plain batter by spoonfuls onto the top. Swirl with a knife to create a marbled effect.
steps.s0004: Bake 55 minutes in the preheated oven, or until filling is set. Run a knife around the edge of the pan. Allow to cool before removing pan rim. Chill for at least 4 hours before serving.

ingredients.i0017: 12 red candy-coated chocolate pieces (such as M&M's®)

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 12-cup mini muffin tin with cooking spray.
steps.s0002: Cream 1/4 cup butter and sugar together in a bowl with an electric mixer. Add egg and vanilla extract; mix well. Stir flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture to butter mixture and mix until batter is smooth. Divide batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups.
steps.s0003: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 14 minutes. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack and let cool, about 20 minutes.
steps.s0004: Meanwhile, combine butter, cocoa powder, and milk in a bowl and mix with an electric mixer until smooth. Gradually add powdered sugar and mix until frosting is smooth and fluffy.
steps.s0005: Spoon frosting in a piping bag fitted with a Wilton #10 tip. Pipe a circle of frosting near the bottom half of each mini brownie to create the turkey's head. Add two candy eyes. Add 1 red chocolate piece to form the beak. Pipe 5 lines of frosting in the shape of a semi-circle formation coming up from the head. Place a piece of candy corn on each of the 5 lines to form the turkey's feathers.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
steps.s0002: Cream together butter, shortening, 1 1/2 cups sugar, the eggs and the vanilla. Blend in the flour, cream of tartar, soda and salt. Shape dough by rounded spoonfuls into balls.
steps.s0003: Mix the 2 tablespoons sugar and the cinnamon. Roll balls of dough in mixture. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets.
steps.s0004: Bake 8 to 10 minutes, or until set but not too hard. Remove immediately from baking sheets.

r0335.title: Orange Cake with Semolina and Almonds

ingredients.i0001: 2 large organic oranges, scrubbed and coarsely chopped (with the skin)
ingredients.i0008: 3 tablespoons brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)

steps.s0001: Combine chopped oranges and 1 tablespoon water in a small saucepan, cover, and cook over medium-low heat until oranges are soft and excess liquid has evaporated, about 30 minutes. Set aside to cool, about 20 minutes.
steps.s0002: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottom and sides of an 8-inch springform pan with parchment paper.
steps.s0003: Place oranges in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until finely chopped.
steps.s0004: Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff peaks form. Gradually add 1/2 cup sugar, continuing to beat for 1 more minute.
steps.s0005: Beat egg yolks and remaining 1/2 cup sugar in a separate bowl until pale and thick, 2 to 3 minutes. Whisk in finely chopped oranges. Fold in ground almonds, semolina, vanilla extract, and fiori di Sicilia. Stir in 3 spoonfuls of whisked egg white to loosen the batter. Gently fold in remaining egg whites with a spatula or large metal spoon. Pour batter into prepared springform and level the top.
steps.s0006: Bake in the preheated oven until cake is golden and a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean, about 50 minutes. Check cake after 20 and 30 minutes to see if it is starting to brown too quickly. Cover top lightly with aluminum foil once cake starts to brown.
steps.s0007: Remove from oven and cool in the pan. Remove ring, peel away parchment paper and transfer cake to a serving plate. Drizzle with liqueur and dust with confectioners' sugar.

ingredients.i0011: 40 miniature chocolate covered peanut butter cups, unwrapped

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Sift together the flour, salt and baking soda; set aside.
steps.s0002: Cream together the butter, sugar, peanut butter and brown sugar until fluffy. Beat in the egg, vanilla and milk. Add the flour mixture; mix well. Shape into 40 balls and place each into an ungreased mini muffin pan.
steps.s0003: Bake at 375 degrees for about 8 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately press a mini peanut butter cup into each ball. Cool and carefully remove from pan.

ingredients.i0003: 1/3 cup white sugar, or to taste
ingredients.i0010: 3 cups thinly sliced sweet, ripe pears
ingredients.i0012: 1/2 tablespoon white sugar, or as needed

steps.s0001: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch baking dish generously with 1 tablespoon butter.
steps.s0002: Whisk eggs, 1/3 cup sugar, milk, salt, nutmeg, vanilla extract, almond extract, and flour together in a bowl for batter.
steps.s0003: Reserve 12 to 14 pear slices for topping and add remaining pear slices to the prepared baking dish. Pour batter over pears in the baking dish and top with almonds. Shake and tap the dish gently on the countertop to let mixture settle. Lay reserved pear slices flat on top. Melt remaining butter and brush over pears. Sprinkle with 1/2 tablespoon sugar.
steps.s0004: Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden, fruit is soft, and custard is set, about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool to room temperature before serving, or serve chilled.

ingredients.i0002: 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND® Sweetened Condensed Milk

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Whisk pumpkin, sweetened condensed milk, eggs, spices and salt in medium bowl until smooth. Pour into crust. Bake 15 minutes.
steps.s0002: Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F and continue baking 35 to 40 minutes or until knife inserted 1 inch from crust comes out clean. Cool. Garnish as desired. Store leftovers covered in refrigerator.

ingredients.i0013: 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple with juice

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8x12 inch pan.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Set aside.
steps.s0003: In a large bowl, combine eggs, buttermilk, oil, sugar and vanilla. Mix well. Add flour mixture and mix well.
steps.s0004: In a medium bowl, combine shredded carrots, coconut, walnuts, pineapple and raisins.
steps.s0005: Using a large wooden spoon or a very heavy whisk, add carrot mixture to batter and fold in well.
steps.s0006: Pour into prepared 8x12 inch pan, and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour. Check with toothpick.
steps.s0007: Allow to cool for at least 20 minutes before serving.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x9 inch pan or line a muffin pan with paper liners.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, cream together the sugar and butter. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Combine flour and baking powder, add to the creamed mixture and mix well. Finally stir in the milk until batter is smooth. Pour or spoon batter into the prepared pan.
steps.s0003: Bake for 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. For cupcakes, bake 20 to 25 minutes. Cake is done when it springs back to the touch.

steps.s0001: In a medium bowl, cream together butter, white sugar, and brown sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla. Combine flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon; stir into the creamed mixture. Mix in oats. Cover, and chill dough for at least one hour.
steps.s0002: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets. Roll the dough into walnut sized balls, and place 2 inches apart on cookie sheets. Flatten each cookie with a large fork dipped in sugar.
steps.s0003: Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

steps.s0001: Boil sweet potato whole in skin for 40 to 50 minutes, or until done.  Run cold water over the sweet potato, and remove the skin.
steps.s0002: Break apart sweet potato in a bowl.  Add butter, and mix well with mixer. Stir in sugar, milk, eggs, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla. Beat on medium speed until mixture is smooth.  Pour filling into an unbaked pie crust.
steps.s0003: Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 55 to 60 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.  Pie will puff up like a souffle, and then will sink down as it cools.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, blend together softened butter, 2 cups flour and 1/2 cup sugar.  Press into the bottom of an ungreased 9x13 inch pan.
steps.s0003: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until firm and golden. In another bowl, whisk together the remaining 1 1/2 cups sugar and 1/4 cup flour. Whisk in the eggs and lemon juice. Pour over the baked crust.
steps.s0004: Bake for an additional 20 minutes in the preheated oven. The bars will firm up as they cool. For a festive tray, make another pan using limes instead of lemons and adding a drop of green food coloring to give a very pale green. After both pans have cooled, cut into uniform 2 inch squares and arrange in a checker board fashion.

steps.s0001: In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in the  flour, baking powder, and salt. Cover, and chill dough for at least one hour (or overnight).
steps.s0002: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Roll out dough on floured surface 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick. Cut into shapes with any cookie cutter. Place cookies 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
steps.s0003: Bake 6 to 8 minutes in preheated oven. Cool completely.

ingredients.i0007: 1/4 cup strong brewed coffee, room temperature

steps.s0001: In a medium saucepan, whisk together egg yolks and sugar until well blended.  Whisk in milk and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture boils.  Boil gently for 1 minute, remove from heat and allow to cool slightly.  Cover tightly and chill in refrigerator 1 hour.
steps.s0002: In a medium bowl, beat cream with vanilla until stiff peaks form.  Whisk mascarpone into yolk mixture until smooth.
steps.s0003: In a small bowl, combine coffee and rum.  Split ladyfingers in half lengthwise and drizzle with coffee mixture.
steps.s0004: Arrange half of soaked ladyfingers in bottom of a 7x11 inch dish.  Spread half of mascarpone mixture over ladyfingers, then half of whipped cream over that.  Repeat layers and sprinkle with cocoa.  Cover and refrigerate 4 to 6 hours, until set.

ingredients.i0001: 1 (18.25 ounce) package devil's food cake mix
ingredients.i0002: 1 (5.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, mix together the cake and pudding mixes, sour cream, oil, beaten eggs and water.  Stir in the chocolate chips and pour batter into a well greased 12 cup bundt pan.
steps.s0003: Bake for 50 to 55 minutes, or until top is springy to the touch and a wooden toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool cake thoroughly in pan at least an hour and a half before inverting onto a plate  If desired, dust the cake with powdered sugar.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Stir together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon. Set aside.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and 1 cup of white sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and maple syrup. Gradually blend in the dry ingredients until just mixed. In a small dish, mix together the remaining 1/2 cup white sugar and the maple sugar. Roll dough into 1 inch balls, and roll the balls in the sugar mixture. Place cookies 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
steps.s0003: Bake 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Cookies will be crackly on top and look wet in the middle. Remove from cookie sheets to cool on wire racks.

steps.s0001: In a medium bowl, mix together cookie crumbs, 3 tablespoons sugar, and melted butter. Press mixture into the bottom of a 9 inch springform pan.
steps.s0002: In a saucepan, combine raspberries, 2 tablespoons sugar, cornstarch, and water. Bring to boil, and continue boiling 5 minutes, or until sauce is thick. Strain sauce through a mesh strainer to remove seeds.
steps.s0003: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). In a metal bowl over a pan of simmering water, melt white chocolate chips with half-and-half, stirring occasionally until smooth.
steps.s0004: In a large bowl, mix together cream cheese and 1/2 cup sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time. Blend in vanilla and melted white chocolate. Pour half of batter over crust. Spoon 3 tablespoons raspberry sauce over batter. Pour remaining cheesecake batter into pan, and again spoon 3 tablespoons raspberry sauce over the top. Swirl batter with the tip of a knife to create a marbled effect.
steps.s0005: Bake for 55 to 60 minutes, or until filling is set. Cool, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 8 hours before removing from pan. Serve with remaining raspberry sauce.

steps.s0001: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, mix together the oil, sugar and 2 teaspoons vanilla until well blended. Combine the flour, 1/2 cup cocoa, baking soda  and salt; stir into the sugar mixture. Fold in the zucchini and walnuts. Spread evenly into the prepared pan.
steps.s0003: Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until brownies spring back when gently touched.
steps.s0004: Make frosting while brownies cool. Melt together the 6 tablespoons of cocoa and margarine; set aside to cool.
steps.s0005: Meanwhile, blend together the confectioners' sugar, milk and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Stir in the cocoa mixture. Spread over cooled brownies before cutting into squares.

steps.s0001: In a blender, blend the milk, yogurt, banana, protein supplement, flax seed, honey, and strawberries until smooth.
Combine milk, cloves, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, and cinnamon in a saucepan, and heat over lowest setting for 5 minutes.  Slowly bring milk mixture to a boil.
steps.s0002: In a large bowl, combine egg yolks and sugar.  Whisk together until fluffy.  Whisk hot milk mixture slowly into the eggs. Pour mixture into saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly for 3 minutes, or until thick.  Do not allow mixture to boil.  Strain to remove cloves, and let cool for about an hour.
steps.s0003: Stir in rum, cream, 2 teaspoon vanilla, and nutmeg.  Refrigerate overnight  before serving.

steps.s0001: In a large pot, combine apple juice, apple cider, sugar and cinnamon sticks. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let cool completely.
